qas.question: The first post- reconstruction era republican elected to florida

answers.text: William C. Cramer in 1954 from Pinellas County
Cramer built a different Republican Party in Florida, attracting local white conservatives and transplants from northern and midwestern states
966 Claude R. Kirk, Jr. was elected as the first post-Reconstruction Republican governor, in an upset election
968 Edward J. Gurney, also a white conservative, was elected as the state's first post-reconstruction Republican US Senator

qas.question: What did the Democrat party do in the 1970

answers.text: 1970 Democrats took the governorship and the open US Senate seat, and maintained dominance for years

qas.question: Who was the first pre-reconstruction era republican elected?
Who was the mid-reconstruction era republican elected?

context: The first post-Reconstruction era Republican elected to Congress from Florida was <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>William C. Cramer<b6_0/><b5_0/> in 1954 from Pinellas County<a0_0/> on the Gulf Coast, where demographic changes were underway. In this period, African Americans were still disenfranchised by the state's constitution and discriminatory practices; in the 19th century they had made up most of the Republican Party. <a1_0>Cramer built a different Republican Party in Florida, attracting local white conservatives and transplants from northern and midwestern states<a1_0/>. In 1<a2_0>966 <b7_0>Claude R. Kirk, Jr<b7_0/>. was elected as the first post-Reconstruction Republican governor, in an upset election<a2_0/>. In 1<a3_0>968 Edward J. Gurney, also a white conservative, was elected as the state's first post-reconstruction Republican US Senator<a3_0/>. In <a4_0>1970 <b8_0>Democrats<b8_0/> took the governorship and the open US Senate seat, and maintained dominance for years<a4_0/>.
